comment:
* Helper functions for the "threads" table used by MMS and SMS.
     *
     * Thread IDs are determined by the participants in a conversation and can be used to match
     * both SMS and MMS messages.
     *
     * To avoid issues where applications might cache a thread ID, the thread ID of a deleted thread
     * must not be reused to point at a new thread.

variables.name: THREAD_ID_CONTENT_URI
variables.comment:
* Private {@code content://} style URL for this table. Used by
         * {@link #getOrCreateThreadId(android.content.Context, java.util.Set)}.

variables.name: CONTENT_URI
variables.comment: * The {@code content://} style URL for this table, by conversation.

variables.name: OBSOLETE_THREADS_URI
variables.comment: * The {@code content://} style URL for this table, for obsolete threads.

methods.name: public static long getOrCreateThreadId(Context context, String recipient)
methods.comment:
* This is a single-recipient version of {@code getOrCreateThreadId}.
         * It's convenient for use with SMS messages.
         * @param context the context object to use.
         * @param recipient the recipient to send to.

methods.name: public static long getOrCreateThreadId(Context context, Set<String> recipients)
methods.comment:
* Given a set of recipients return its thread ID. *

* If a thread exists containing the provided participants, return its thread ID. Otherwise, * this will create a new thread containing the provided participants and return its ID.

methodNames: public static long getOrCreateThreadId(Context context, String recipient)
public static long getOrCreateThreadId(Context context, Set<String> recipients)
